title: Georgia House - Day 38 (2026-03-30)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House session transcript:

## Overview
This session was focused on preparing Georgia for the transition to electric vehicles, with the House passing a resolution to create a joint study committee on the electrification of transportation. There was bipartisan support expressed for this effort, acknowledging the importance of developing the necessary charging infrastructure and ensuring Georgia is prepared for the coming shift to electric vehicles.

## Key Actions
**SR 463**: Resolution creating the joint study committee on the electrification of transportation

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None noted in the transcript.

## Notable Moments
- Representatives Jasper, Powell, and Parsons spoke in support of the resolution, highlighting the need to get Georgia ready for the transition to electric vehicles.
- There was discussion of previous work done in committees on issues related to electric vehicle infrastructure and policy.

## Votes
**SR 463**: Passed with no objections noted.

## Attendance
Quorum was present, as the House was in session.

## Adjournment
The transcript does not mention the time of adjournment or the date of the next session.
